sentences.english: When boiling vegetables, use enough water to cover them and keep the lid on the saucepan.
sentences.chinese: 煮菜时，用水将菜充实吞没，并将锅盖盖上。

sentences.english: The tsunami that followed engulfed the northeast and wiped out entire towns.
sentences.chinese: 随后的海啸淹没了日本东北，吞没了整个城镇。

sentences.english: The whirlpool sucked in the boat.
A wave of grief engulfed them.
sentences.chinese: 汹涌的大海吞没了那艘小机帆船。

sentences.english: The whirlpool sucked down the canoe.
The death toll of a big fire that engulfed a high-rise building in downtown Shanghai had risen to 53 by 9:20 a.m.
sentences.chinese: 昨天，上海市中区的一栋住宅楼被大火吞没。

sentences.english: A rainforest restoration project in southern China is engulfed by fire.
sentences.chinese: 中国南部的归还热带雨林计划遭火海吞没。

sentences.english: And see the brave day sunk in hideous night.
“But it was impossible not to be swallowed, ” Mukherjee writes.
sentences.chinese: “但不可能不被吞没，”穆克吉写道。
火焰吞没了那座博物馆。

sentences.english: We stay out, and watch genocide engulf Rwanda.
sentences.chinese: 我们洁身自好，却眼见种族灭绝吞没卢旺达。

sentences.english: The enemy planes were licked up by flames.
In later paintings, the mountain was engulfed in ominous black clouds.
sentences.chinese: 稍后些的画里，这座山已被恶劣的黑云吞没。

sentences.english: There is a loud roar and a light engulfs them.
sentences.chinese: 一阵巨大的咆哮和一阵强光吞没了他们。

sentences.english: An angry billow almost swallowed that ship.
sentences.chinese: 怒涛几乎吞没了那条船。

sentences.english: Disappointment flooded through me as my eyes unerringly focused on his table.
sentences.chinese: 当我的目光准确地投向他的桌子时，失望吞没了我。

definition: to submerge/to drown/to flood/to drown out (also fig.)
to surge up violently (of ocean, river, lake etc)/turbulent
to bury/to submerge/to pass into oblivion/to obliterate/to annihilate (physics)
to go up in smoke/to vanish
to cover/to hide from view/to obstruct or block/defilade (military)
